intro: Fumaria africana var. platycentra, commonly known as the broad-centred yellowweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, elongated seeds.
